name: Jordan Crook
text:
I have been thinking for a while about how to even put into words how amazing the whole staff of Seiler skin is-- they are so kind and inviting from the moment you walk into the door to the time you leave (even though you'll want to stay longer). :)  Dr. Seiler and Leigh Anne Gelinas have been working with me since the end of June, and I am so honored/excited to continue receiving treatment from them!
During my initial consultation with the two of them, they were attentive and empathetic with all of the skin/body issues that have been bothering me for years-- specifically my hormonal acne. Side note: they don't just focus on skin-- they also made amazing recommendations for me in regard to my chronic migraines! I have been so discouraged after trying countless "solutions", programs, and even visiting other doctors/experts that have literally said "there's really not much else you can do for hormonal acne." Dr. Seiler and Leigh Ann have so much great knowledge, and I was so comforted and encouraged to hear their recommendations and plan of treatment. In fact, I almost burst into tears when Dr. Seiler said, "We are going to get this handled for you."
After ONE WEEK of being on the new skincare regimen they suggested for me (which, by the way, is incredibly simple and takes about 1-2 minutes), my skin was noticeably clearer (insane, right?!). I am still in shock by how much my skin has improved in such a short amount of time. For the first time in forever, I am much more confident in my skin and can actually go without concealer if I want to! Also, Leigh Ann is SO fun and easy to talk to, and I always look forward to my appointments with her. Being a graduate college student, finances are somewhat tight. However, they have an amazing VIP program full of so many discounts and perks (never seen anything like it before), and they also understood where I was coming from and provided cost-effective options. If you're on the fence about making an appointment with them, know that IT IS WORTH IT. I could go on and on about how much I love this place, and I want everyone to experience what I have with them.

resp.text: Jordan, this is absolutely amazing! We are SO happy you are loving your skin! Thank you so much for such wonderful feedback on your experience with our staff, Dr. Seiler and Leigh Ann. It is a pleasure to have you as our patient and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: T Hill
text: I recently visited Seiler Skin after a very undesirable experience at another skin care practice in Birmingham. My visit to Seiler was fabulous from the time I was greeted until I left. Every staff member is friendly, knowledgeable and goes above and beyond to ensure comfort and clearly puts the client's needs first. Dr. Seiler was truly amazing! He provided options clearly and fully explained what he would do for the most favorable outcome. I'm looking forward to a long relationship with the staff at Seiler Skin!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing this wonderful feedback! We are so happy to hear how much you've enjoyed your experience at our office! We are excited to have you as our patient!

name: Bre Carr
text:
I recently visited Seiler Skin for a consultation and my experience was great. Prior to my appointment I did thorough research on appropriate and research based laser treatment options for African American skin. This is very important to me when determining the best route of treatment and having a doctor who is culturally competent.

I am currently working with Dr. Seiler to reduce the appearance of burn scars I obtained during childhood on the back of both of my legs, scars that I have been self conscious about for over 25 years.

He and his staff were extremely personable and welcoming. I felt very comfortable and human (if that makes sense)  I honestly felt that he is just as committed to my treatment as I am. He was very thorough during our consultation and  reassuring by creating an individualized treatment plan to help me achieve the best and most realistic results possible.

I am super excited and looking forward to working with Dr. Seiler as we navigate my treatment over the next few months.

resp.text: Bre, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! I read it to our team this morning during our "morning huddle" and it warmed our hearts. We love what we do and can't thank you enough for sharing this feedback with us and others. We are so excited to have you as our patient and look forward to seeing you again soon!

text: Nice staff and facility. I believe the services are over priced. name: Christine Blakley
text: I had botox plus some lamp probe around my nose for broken capillaries. First, let me just say that Dr. Seiler has a gentle touch with botox! It was pain-free, and he kept me talking and comfortable the entire time. The lamp probe procedure was quick but had a kick - but nothing I couldn't tolerate and the little red veins are already almost gone in less than 24 hours. Very worth it! I'm going to go back in late summer for a vampire facial. I am so impressed by Dr. Seiler, his staff, and how knowledgeable and friendly everyone is in the office. This is my new place - and I'll recommend it to everyone who wants to look and feel their best. (I'll add that for my initial consultation, he spent almost a half an hour talking to me, making suggestions, and answering questions. I've never had a consultation that comprehensive and it made me feel like choosing Seiler Skin was the right choice!)

resp.text: Hi Christine, thank you for this wonderful feedback! So awesome to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with Dr. Seiler and our staff as well as your results!! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Rebecca ledbetter
text:
I chose Dr. Seiler after experiencing several years of unsatisfactory results from procedures I had received from another practice.  I was searching for an environment in which concerns about my skin and questions about treatments were answered honestly based on a thorough consultation specific to my needs. I wanted to be given realistic expectations rather than "before and after" pictures and stories of previous patients results.
I had become accustomed to this type of communication from my previous physician and as a result, after spending thousands of dollars,
I was rarely, if ever, satisfied.
As a patient, one needs to feel listened to, and cared for not only by the Doctor, but the staff as well.  So far Seiler Skin has checked all my boxes in meeting these expectations.
Results from scheduled procedures will occur in the next few weeks, but I don't think I have been given a sales pitch nor have I felt pressured into doing anything that I'm unsure of.
For the first time I feel as if I'm working with someone who has my best interests at the forefront and that is how it should be.

resp.text: Rebecca, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! It means so much to us and it’s truly our pleasure to have you as our patient. We are so excited about your treatment plan! Thank you for putting your trust in us. Can’t wait to see you at your next visit!

text: Tension Headaches completely gone!!! I get Botox injected in my neck and jaw to get rid of my headaches and it's worked so much better than I could ever hope. About a year ago I was getting headaches almost daily because of my terrible and completely uncontrollable habit of clenching my jaw while I slept. I was also feeling pretty insecure about my face, my weight hadn't changed but my face always looked so puffy. Turns out my jaw muscles were just massive. After my initial injection with Botox (which was pretty much painless) it took about three weeks before I started to notice I wasn't waking up with headaches. After 3 months my face started to slim out. After about a year my face finally looked like my old face again (my cheekbones look so good)! The lines in my neck have also become a lot less noticable. Dr. Seiler is absolutely incredible, I can not recommend him and his team enough!

text:
This is my second time at Dr. Willis' office and it will definitely be my last. The first  time I went to her office  I didn't have any problems besides having to call to get my results and the office not answering their phones. This year her office emailed me about making my yearly appointment which I did. I called the office and was sent to voicemail which they ask you to leave information. After three days of not getting a response I called the office and the receptionist was nice and scheduled me for the only available appointment until August. The next day I received a call from another receptionist responding to my voicemail that I sent earlier that week..... The day of the appointment I called Dr. Willis office EIGHT times trying to get someone to help me locate the office (I hadn't been there in two years because of school). After the first three calls not being answered (15 minutes late to the appointment at this point) I was transferred to the emergency line (was on hold for 5 mins). Without even asking my needs I was transferred to another hotline which transferred me to another hotline that transferred me back to the original person I was trying to speak with! After being on hold multiple times for almost 15 minutes I hung up, called back and the exact same thing happened again. After 30 minutes of trying to find the office I finally was able to talk to someone and ended up canceling the appointment.

This was the most frustrating and difficult doctor's experience I've ever had. I do no recommend!

name: Brannigan Keller
text:
Edited from a 1 star to a 5 star

My 2 year old child was a new patient and one of his siblings got sick the day of the appointment. I called to try to reschedule and was informed that I would be charged a no show fee. I do not think they could have made me pay the $50 no show fee as I had never been to this business before and more importantly was not aware of this ridiculous amount but called my spouse to make arrangements to go.  Needless to say they lost mine and my families business, I would not recommend them to anyone as my experience is not how to treat customers.

I’ve changed my negative review to a positive one after receiving a phone call from the owner of this practice.  It’s nice that he took the time to call and listen to my concerns while making attempts to set things right. I understand why these “no show” policies have to be in place as I work in the healthcare field as well.  After talking to the owner I would recommend this business.

resp.text: Ms. Keller, Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize that this was your experience. Charging for missed appointments due to illness is not and has never been our policy. Again, we apologize.

text: Saw Dr. Rayna Dyck(she was recommended by some people i know personally). & she was horrible. She first off camebin very dry which is a horrible first impression and my attitude immediately was based off of hers and by her attitude being so dry (seemed like she really didn’t want to be at work) it made me not believe anything she said or that she didn’t care to help ...although everything she said might have been true. Her staff though is very sweet. I didn’t get the medication she thought MIGHT help b/c it was pointless to purchase out of pocket if it MIGHT help. And the two reasons she said i might have skin discoloration was definitely not my case. I’m big on reviews & she had a few reviews on her dry attitude but i gave her the benefit of the doubt because i had people who recommended her..obviously b/c she helped their condition & not off her attitude. She was so awkward & dry. Def. appreciate Dr. Hartman for giving me a call about my visit and hopefully i dont have to pay another co-pay when i fu with him b/c today i def. paid a co-pay for no reason at all. and the stars are for the staff and him calling me back def. not for Dr. Dyck.

name: Gillian McCown
text:
Dr. Youhn had the nerve and audacity to tell me that I should wean my son. Last I checked, breastfeeding is outside her scope of practice and she has no business giving professional advice about childcare or breastfeeding to a patient. It is unethical to give advice or direction on any topic professionally outside one’s scope. Breastfeeding and the health and wellness of my son most definitely are.

Updated because they decided to be unprofessional with their response here and on Facebook.

These comments started when I was asked if he was my only one and if I was thinking about having more yet and I said I'm still not sleeping so no. She kept saying should really talk to his ped because he doesn't need to be nursing all night long. At his size he doesn't need to eat at night and he's probably just doing it out of comfort. I didn't ask for sleep advice.
I mean I could understand her saying the nursing could be irritating my issue and that weaning might be something to consider.
But talking about how my son doesn't need to nurse anymore and I should really just talk to his pediatrician about weaning him is way beyond her scope and none of her damn business!
His pediatrician has no problem with it and nursing till 2 is recommended by the WHO.

name: Gina Delbianco
text: The Chelsea office is aweful. I've been taking my daughter's here for skin care for a long time now...mostly because we live in Chelsea and it's convenient. I've decided I've had enough of their extremely snooty, unfriendly staff. We had been seeing Dr. Murphy in this office for years and then one day she just  magically dissapears and is replaced by a different dermatologist with no explanation. Nothing!  Can't stand this office!!  We wiill be moving on to a new dermatologist and hopefully a smiling, friendly and much more upbeat atmosphere!   Alert people! Five minutes after posting this review My phone rings and this man states is name is Dr. Hartman ..and demands to know my reasonings for posting this review! This is just too unreal for me! Skin wellness of Chelsea ...you are sketchy!!!!!!  Ok so now I'm getting harrassing messages from two different area codes regarding this review. I guess Skin wellness pays some crappy people to harrass people that give bad reviews in hopes they will erase it. Not going to happen. You're Chelsea office sucks!....Excuse me! Whoever you are..her name was Brittany and she treated my children's skin problems for years. And please . ..stop texting your profane messsges to my phone!

name: Lillian Byner
text: In response to Dr. Hartman's reply to my review, I appreciate your telephone call. However, as I communicated to you in our conversation last night which you neglected to include in your response, I have waited for a return call to my non-urgent issue way longer than 24-48 hours. My first follow-up appointment where the biopsy was taken was on June 13th, where I was told by a clinician that I would know the results before I left for vacation. I called for results initially 1 or 2 days before I left town June 23rd. I then called back on the 28th, where I was told once again that I would be called back before close of business, yet I was not. I was never informed by any of your staff that I spoke with (both clinical and non-clinical - I have spoken with both) of the 10-14 day timeframe for biopsy results. In speaking with you last night is the first I have heard of the 10-14 day waiting period for results and the results not being discussed until the scheduled follow-up visit. Perhaps some form of training refresher would be useful in ensuring that all of the staff, both clinical and non-clinical are relaying uniform information and setting the proper expectations to the patients. Once again, I appreciate your reaching out to me and I am sorry that I had a less than desirable experience.

text: Skin RX is beautiful, safe and comfortable. Very, very clean.  My experience was amazing!  The staff and owner are friendly with great hospitality!  My results were beyond my expectations!  Do yourself a favor and pamper yourself soon. Get your skin ready for the holidays!

resp.text: Thank you so much Cindy for your kind words and thoughtful feedback! We look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Savie S
text: Normally I would rate this place 5 stars but I feel like I was majorly ripped off earlier this week on an IPL facial. Let me explain, I’ve been coming into this place to get full-face IPL treatments done for about a year. I’ve had three total treatments done in the span of a year. The first two treatments cost me $150. The second time I came in my specialist informed me that the prices will raise to $200 per IPL session. No problem for me, well... I came in earlier this week to get only CHEEKS and CHIN done and she charged me $350$!!! NO ONE informed me it would be that high! Last time I came in I was told $200. $350 for a partial face treatment is absolutely insane price. I’ve been getting these treatments done all over the country and I’ve NEVER had anyone charge me that much for a partial face IPL. Honestly, she should have told me before the treatment that it would be that much! I’ve seen her three times. I didn’t want to make a big deal about it by the time she charged me because I didn’t want to cause a scene but I’m honestly very unhappy with the lack of communication from this business. And what a shame because I really liked this place. ):

resp.text: Hi Savie. We informed you at your last IPL appointment there was a price increase expected. Prior to your next appointment, a year or so later, we left 2 voicemails to be sure you were prepared for the new pricing. I do hope you can find happiness & safe and effective IPL treatments within your budget range somewhere else.

name: Derick and Becky Honore
text: I had a facial done by Kaylee. It felt amazing. She was super friendly, knew what she was doing, and attentive to my needs. My face felt so refreshed when I left. I would definitely recommend! ❤️

resp.text: Thank you so much for your thoughtful feedback!

name: Margo Freeman
text:
DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!  I went to Skin Rx in Madison because the doctor I usually use was going to be out after having surgery.  The girl at the front desk was terribly rude!  Very unprofessional.  Even went as far as to ask me HOW I got an appointment with them...she was the one who made the appointment when I called!!   I was charged $420.00
For Botox and since receiving,  four days later, there are absolutely ZERO signs that I ever got Botox!!!
I have been doing Botox for 10 years...when my regular doctor does it, I see the results the next day!!!
Again...don’t waste your money here!  One star is too much!!

resp.text: Hi Margo. I'm so sorry you did not enjoy your experience at SkinRx. I am the owner of SkinRx, Clair Frankel, and I was the 'girl' at the front desk when you arrived. As with every client who enters our doors, I did try my best to be warm, welcoming and make you feel comfortable. I'm so sorry you did not feel the same and I wish you all the best in your aesthetic pursuits. Botox may take 7 to 10 days to be fully effective.

My sister and I travel together over two hours to go there. They always remember our names no matter how long it’s been since we have been there. The doctor is very nice and professional. My sister has had fillers and she looks 10 years younger. I have had laser treatment on my inner thighs and love handles and it really made a difference. We both get weight loss medication, adipex. It WORKS!! I can’t say enough good things about them.

name: Amanda Valdez
text:
Amazing group of professionals! They are up to date on the latest beauty trends while also taking the time to continue to educate themselves on the ever changing technology and skin care. Not only can you schedule a visit for cosmetic enhancements and maintenance to LOOK younger, their massage therapists and esthetician can pamper you and make you FEEL younger. Do you hate shaving? If you’re up for the challenge, go see Lydia for Laser hair removal! It’s worth every penny!

They offer great monthly deals to make sure everyone has an opportunity to look and feel their best!

The staff, environment, and affordability easily makes this the best Medical Spa in Madison/Huntsville!

name: Jesse Lyons Live
text: I could not have had a better experience at Growing Younger Clinic! I was treated like royalty from the moment I walked in the door. The facility is laid out well, the decor is tasteful and warm, and most importantly the place is very clean. I knew I was in good hands from the moment I walked up to the front desk. Their prices on procedures are incredible comparatively to other med spas. I had Miradry performed, and paid literally half of what all the spas and doctors offices in my area charge. Dr. Jamey performed my anesthesia and made sure I was comfortable and well numbed. Lydia was the technician who performed the procedure and she was thorough at explaining and was very warm and friendly. I also had cool sculpting done, and Emory checked on me multiple times throughout the procedure to make sure I was doing fine. World class staff!! I was blown away. I'll be back to get more work done. It's worth the 7.5 hour drive!

name: C
text:
I scheduled an appointment for a facial, a month ago. Called the day before about the possibility of canceling.  She told me if I canceled then there is a 25.00 fee. I decided that I will take off work and go. I get there at 9:45  was told they couldn't  find my name and it was canceled anyway. Front desk staff on the phone and in office was rude and knew nothing about the lady working the afternoon before.  Had to reschedule and the next appointment is a month away. Might just have to pass and go somewhere else.
Edit to add that Tonya called me immediately to squeeze me in the next day. I couldn't get out of work again soo .

Even when the hair is somewhat visible, you can't feel it. It feels bare like baby skin. The staff are nice and I really like the woman that does my treatments.

text: I went to get a microdermabrasion treatment there last week, mind you I have had several before but just moved to Huntsville and was hoping to find a place I could go and have one every few months... the woman who did mine was beyond RUDE ! She spoke maybe 5 words to me and I’ve never had such a harsh treatment the towels they use are not soft and she rubs your face like she’s scrubbing clothes! I will never return to this spa if you can call it that .. don’t expect anything nice if you go!! If I could rat them a 0 I would... AWFUL experience ! Go anywhere else but here!!!!!

text: Upscale facility, friendly staff and highly recommend. Will return for another massage.

name: MyLifeAsMycah
text: I've been going to Growing Younger for the last 7 months. I stumbled upon them on Groupon and took up an offer for laser hair removal. As an AA woman, I can attest that this place provides wonderful results. Amanda is my laser specialist and she is amazing. Definitely give them a try!

name: Christy Tallant
text: I absolutely love the services that I have received at Growing Younger. I am going on my second week of services with them. Since I have been going I have seen a dramatic change in my appearance. Their staff is well trained and is willing to answer any questions you have. I love the fact that when you walk into the building they welcome you with a smile and a hello. Darlicia always has a smile on her face. She is very knowledgeable and helpful during my procedures. I would recommend Growing Younger to all my friends.

name: Angela Drensek
text: I have been going to Growing Younger for just over a year now.  I have had Microderm Abrasions, Facials, skin tag removal, and laser hair removal.  My face texture is completely different than it was a year ago.  Their trained staff teaches you how to take care of your skin offering advice and wonderful products.  My makeup goes on better, and sometimes I don't even wear any makeup - the change has been that dramatic.  I have micros and facials once a month and have been doing so for the past year.  I have also undergone laser hair removal and after 6 appointments I have great results.  Being dark headed this is a life changing improvement.  I had my legs and underarms done - it is great not to have to shave.  I highly recommend Growing Younger.

name: Nilda Rivera
text: The staff  needs to ask more info on the phone prior to your appointment.  When you get there they tell you the doctors only there Thursday .

name: Kristin Barnett
text: I had a microdermabrasion facial. It was awesome. They had me in right on time and the girl was very nice and professional. My skin felt wonderful!!! I also had the B12 shots and was able to walk in and out with virtually no wait time.

name: Terri Thompson
text: Was badly burned by esthetician and received permanent damage during laser hair removal in 2015. No remedial action was taken on the clinic's part so I had to file complaints with BBB, Alabama Board of Cosmetology and because the owner is a chiropractor, had to file a complaint with the Alabama Board of Chiropractic Examiners. He was put on 5 years probation and fined several thousand dollars for unprofessional conduct and for performing services outside the scope of a chiropractic license--if the fine isn't paid by the deadline, his license will be suspended for that period of time. Do not recommend this clinic for laser services. None of my expenses (doctor, cosmetics, or even the botched laser service) were reimbursed by the clinic.

name: Ciearra Jackson
text: Enjoyed the staff and the service! Everyone was so friendly and efficient. The environment is so inviting. I didn't have just tremendous results with iLipo, but then again I did not increase my physical activity. However, the staff was great during the process, and I felt very informed about the procedure. I have a message waiting, and I can't wait to have some time away from work to use it. I definitely recommend Growing Younger to anyone in the Huntsville area.

name: Nyla Blakley
text:
Staff so friendly and reassuring. Everyone is so professional and I highly recommend.
Anything from weight loss, facial, massage, chiropractic and great advice on health products.

name: Malinda Powers
text: Hot flashes and night sweats are gone!  Easy treatment.  I can't believe that I struggled with them for 3 years when this was so easy.

name: Kanetha Jackson
text: Always have amazing results after Botox treatments!

name: Sandra Wilson
text:
Had a special running.
I had originally wanted an anti aging facial.
Tech talked me out of it, because of my skin condition. Opted for microdermabrasion.
She paid more attention to my forehead..didnt go near my folds around my nose.
Be prepared to fill out your medical life on paper, and then have them not look at it.
We did not do a full hour, which was the time that was suppose to be allotted.
As soon as the tech was tipped, she be lined to the employees office.
Certainly didnt feel very welcome or appreciated for my patronage.

name: Olivia Colvin
text:
I love this place! Think I stumbled upon this gem from Groupon originally. The staff is friendly, the place is impeccably clean every visit (I’ve been here about 6-7 times now.) Thus far I have only used their b-12 shots spartically for managing my anemia, but I love that I can get in and out every time, no appointment and longest I’ve ever waited was maaaybe five minutes! They offer unique monthly specials for a wide variety of services (massages, shots, facial treatments, non invasive body contouring) and never ever try to upsell me anything. I wish they offered more vitamin injection options, but that’s just me.

For the record, I am pretty sure that I have brought anywhere from one to three children with me at any given time and never once has the staff been rude or unwelcoming in the least (or maybe I just have that “Don’t even think about it” look down better than I thought!) I appreciate that as a mother I don’t get annoyed looks from the staff just for walking in the door.

Definitely looking forward to continuing my visits here for b12 and thinking about trying other treatments/services with this place in the future!

name: Amber Litteken
text: Everyone is very professional. Lazer hair removal is 100% worth it.

name: A. Zachery
text: I called to see if I could reschedule my appointment because I didn't want to be late, but I couldn't. The Groupon had already been redeemed by the business and there was a 24 hour cancellation policy. I understand the policy but why was my Groupon redeemed before services were rendered. When I finally got there through traffic, they said that I would only have 20 minutes for a massage.  I politely said ,"Thats okay, it's been a long week and my birthday is tomorrow. Dont worry about it."  So I left and I was a little hurt by the customer service I had received at this point and I went back in to ask if they were apart of the BBB, because at this point I saw where this was going.  The young lady at the front was really rude toward me and so was the man who is a massage therapists. I have scoliosis and I was looking for some relief for my birthday. I'm African American and I am just wondering if I wasn't, if it would've made a difference at all. I called to ask about the policy because I want to be treated fairly. The phone disconnected while I was asking and when I called back it went to voicemail. I called back from a different number and the phone was answered then it was passed to a man works there and he was even more rude than the young lady working at the front. I was in shock how fast he got annoyed with me and I wasn't being disrespectful at all. He then said that if I called back he would file harassment charges against me, then hung up me in my face. As a first time customer, I felt like I was treated really badly. I will not be going back to this business EVER AGAIN and I pray that justice is served for how I was treated.

name: Cassandra Henry
text: I have truly enjoyed Growing Younger for several services. I recommend Growing Younger to ALL my colleagues and friends.  Darlicia and Trista and just simply amazing. They made me feel so comfortable.  My husband comments every day that he notices the results of the ilipo ultra!!  I cannot express enough how much I value the experience I've had at Growing Younger.

name: Daphne Tabis
text: I visited Growing Younger a few times for i-Lipo treatments. I was very impressed by the friendly staff; they were professional, knowledgeable, and willing to answer all of my questions. I appreciated the appearance/ decor and cleanliness of the facilities. I look forward to future visits.

name: cecilia uselton
text: Trista is AWESOME!  I've had facial treatments at Growing Younger and it is a GREAT place to go.  Staff is nice and helpful.

name: Kaitlyn Gregg
text: I got the microdermabrasion. I found a Groupon and it was only $26 so I decided to give it a try. Overall, as this being my first facial I was not impressed and probably won't be back. A lady named Tonia did my facial. She wasn't knowledgeable about the products she was using. When I asked her questions, I got very blunt answers. After she cleansed my face, she dried it with what felt like a paper towel, and I don't know about y'all but a paper towel being scraped across your face after you just had a "vacuum" scrape it, is not comfortable. The microdermabrasion part itself was fine. But the before and after how she cleansed and dried my face was not ideal. I feel like they used very low quality moisturizers and lotions. I was surprised they didn't use any serums.

text: I have recieved B12 shots at Growing Younger and I couldn't be happier.  I have noticed I have been more energized.  The staff is wonderful and friendly.  I definitely recommend Growing Younger.

Growing younger is always up to date with the lastest treatments, etc and the facilities are always well maintained! I know they always have amazing promotions going on and I definitely will be back to try some of their other services!

name: Alicia Chambers
text: Growing younger has become my favorite place to visit. I've received peels, microdermabrasion, and B12 shots. The staff is so friendly, they make you feel so welcome. Trista is my favorite! I would highly recommend their services. They've also worked me in the on the day I called for a treatment. I return as often as I can. Great monthly specials and groupons as well.

name: Pamela Beckwith
text: Very pleased with service and the professionalism and kindness the staff offers.

name: Amber Harwell
text: I have received Botox plenty of times. My first experience with Growing Younger was a month ago and I received what they recommended I needed which was twice as much as I normally got at my other doctor. After a month I noticed that it was already wearing off. So I go back in and Dr. Wagner seemed very frustrated and stormed off and came back with Botox to fix the problem. I have never felt such pain while receiving Botox and hours later I still have a terrible headache. I’m pretty sure he took his frustration out on my forehead! Not only did I think their Botox was deluted but they also overcharged me $111.00. They charged me for 10 extra units that I never recieved. When I mentioned my refund they wanted to do a “store credit”. After refusing the store credit Dr. Wagner said “Well what do you want??” I replied my money back on my card! He refunded my money and I nicely said thank you. He replied yep and I walked out. Such a rude and awkward visit! I can’t believe he actually thought I would want to return back to use my $111 of store credit after he acted the way he did.

name: Tim Jordan
text:
Unprofessional treatment, they are nice till they get your money then treat unprofessional.
personal experience without going into much detail, but i would not recommend them to anyone

text: Really friendly staff & their Groupons make it affordable for me!

name: Jennifer McCoy
text: The staff at the Growing Younger office was great. The specials that are offered are great!

name: Debra Mears
text: Went in because I noticed the Botox walk in Thursday flags and was about to leave in a couple weeks for my 60th Birthday trip. I got Botox and Juvederm done on my face. I would NEVER go back there or recommend them for either treatment. I had to go back a week later because the side of my mouth was caving in and they added more Juvederm. They said they had used a full syringe on me which I don't believe because the last place I had it done only used a half with better results! The BIG problem is  they said they used 40 units of Botox which last time I only got 20, they did not ask how many units I wanted! My eyes are practically closed and I can't open them. You can't see my eyelids at all and I can't raise my eyes up. Instead of looking better for my trip I looked awful with my nearly closed eyes. Everyone that knows me asked what did you do to your eyes??? Thank GOD Botox does not last to long and I'm praying this is a temporary result that will go back to normal. I thought they would be cheaper but they were the same price as my plastic surgeon only faster to walk in. I will wait to get an appointment with a professional surgeon next time. Not worth messing with my vision!

name: Anthony King
text:
Upon arrival I was met at the door and they took my temperature and asked me a series of questions pertaining to the Covid virus before I was allowed to enter the building. My visit went well and the doctor went over everything and explained in detail everything about my condition and the meds that he wanted me to take. He wasn’t in a hurry and made sure I understood what he was talking about. The whole staff was courteous and professional.
Thanks

name: Marie Fells
text: I have been a patient of Dr Lowe's for many years. I have never had a problem he couldn't find. I recognize Dr. Lowe to everyone. I Love All of the employees here.

name: Trebor Llorrac
text: Dr. Lowe is the worst doctor I've ever visited. He seems to think all my health problems come from smoking. I smoke about a pack of day by the way. I have restless leg syndrome, a jaw condition called TMJ, diabetes and a good bit of joint pain. it doesn't matter what health condition I want to talk about, he blames all my health problems on smoking. My dad was diabetic and smoked 3 to 4 packs a day. He did not have all these aches and pains that I have. My boss is in his sixties, smokes cigarettes and is diabetic. He does not complain of aches and pains at all. I understand smoking may irritate a pre-existing condition. But the key word here is pre-existing condition. There must be something else going on. I was hit by a car and knocked down when I was little. I have had problems with my hip since. Dr Lowe refuses to look at it because I haven't quit smoking cigarettes yet. All of my aches and pains come from smoking cigarettes and I'm diabetic. I  complained about a lot of pain in my right leg on my last visit. He refused to look at it because I still smoke. So I went to doctors care across from walmart  who found that I had a torn muscle and soft tissue damage. But he actually looked at it. I will be replacing doctor lowe as soon as other doctors are allowing new patients. I wish doctors care accepted my insurance. I am sick and tired of getting blown off because he is against smoking. If somebody comes in and complains about something ,it should be looked at. He acts like I have the plague because I smoke. My husband is dying to have a word with him. But I do my best to keep my husband away because my husband will bite his freaking head off. He is very protective of me. I wonder if I can find a veterinarian to take care of me. I'm sure they would do a better job than doctor lowe does. And they probably wouldn't talk to me like a dog as as badly dr. Lowe does. Worst doctor i have visited so far in my life.

text: I have been a client a Azia since they opened.  The staff is so friendly and knowledgeable.  The services are outstanding and reasonably priced.  I very rarely have to wait as they keep appointments on schedule and timely.  Krista has worked with me for both medical weight loss and skin treatments.  She is always readily available for questions, extremely concerned with getting the desired result and client satisfaction.  I have also been a patient for Dr. Cox for both botox and dermal fillers.  Krista assists him during my treatments.  Dr. Cox is always most concerned with giving me the proper treatment for the results that I want.  He is very honest and caring and always desires to keep results natural rather than over doing it.  Both Krista and Dr. Cox are caring and professional and I am always pleased with my results.  They are both more than willing to make adjustments if a client is not satisfied, although I have never had to go back for that.  They also call after a procedure to make sure you are satisfied with your results, which is rare for most spas.  I could not recommend Azia more highly due to the staff, the relaxing facility and the wonderful staff and service they provide.  They truly care about the clientele.

name: Helen
text: While the staff members were nice, I was very disappointed in the results of my visit. I bought a groupon for 100 units of dysport thinking that 100 units instead of 50 would be ample. I was a bit concerned when the nurse tried to confirm that I was a getting 50 units. I asked the doctor's advice about the coverage, and she did not indicate I would need to buy more units. It has been about a month, and I still have movement in all areas injected.  The wrinkles aren't as strong but still there.  Also the areas over the corners of my brows were not treated, and I have this strange Spock look when I raise my brows. Of course, I called after about 2 weeks to let them know that the treated areas still had a lot of movement, and they quickly explained that they do not do any re-treatment with Groupons.  I understand that I  supposedly got a "deal" but I also still paid for a service and was assured when I booked my appointment that I would love the results.. I know Groupons are to get new customers in the door but with this experience, I will not go back. I have used a Groupon at another spa, and they re-treated me to get the results that were expected.  I had an appt with my dermatologist a few weeks after this, and she said that 100 disport units should have taken care of all the areas I had treated. My experience may have been completely different if I had paid full price.  Lesson learned.

name: Keara Norris
text:
I recently had my first (but definitely not last visit) to Azia Medical Spa.  I had a GroupOn voucher & was a little concerned that I may be shortchanged because I was there on a “coupon”.  All my fears were immediately put to rest from the initial phone call to make my appointment.  I had let time get away from me and had less than a week to use my GroupOn voucher or lose the promotional value.  The lady on the phone, Katrina I think, was understanding & made me an appointment for the next day.  Bonus point because I was able to get my appointment on a Saturday.

When I arrived, I was greeted by name & offered a drink.  After paperwork, I was introduced to Jennifer Pyles who explained that she is double licensed and would do both my massage & facial.  I was extremely pleased with this because it allowed me to stay relaxed throughout the treatments and not have to move into a new area.  Jennifer was professional, attentive & through.  Her pressure level was perfect & she checked in occasionally to make sure it stayed that way.  She even surprised me by telling me she could tell I was right handed & spent a lot of time at a computer due to the tension level in certain areas.  That really showed me how skilled she is.  After the massage, Jennifer moved directly into my express facial.  She walked me through the process & gave me a brief skin analysis.  She suggested products & services I could benefit from.  She was also kind enough to suggest some over the counter products when I asked about them.  After the appointment, she left a list of the items & services we discussed at the front desk for me.

After my time with Jennifer, I was allowed to wait in the sauna while the nail technician finished with another client.  The temperature was just right for relaxation and I had to avoid nodding off.

Next, Badri Roshan, the nail technician came to get me for my manicure.  She was a very nice lady with whom I enjoyed talking.  I loved her accent & chatting with her about her background and what drew her to Birmingham.  As a testament to her work. I have received several compliments on my nails.

As I checked out, I neglected to get the name of the lady at the front desk but she was very friendly and helped me run my card to leave a tip for Jennifer & Badri.  I loved that while I was invited back, no services or products were pushed on me.  I am looking forward to all my future visits and spreading the news that Azia Medical Spa is money and time well spent!!!

name: Jenny O'Neal
text: Jennifer gives an awesome massage.  She listens to your needs and addresses problem areas.

text: I had a wonderful, relaxing experience at Azia.  The staff is professional and courteous.  Check out their monthly specials.

name: Jimmy Vickers
text: This stop is ok considering in the location.

name: Stacy Leslie
text: Awesome!

name: elise sappington
text: I just left Cahaba Dermatology and I would say my experience could have been better. The doctor I saw was phenomenal. She was very well educated and informative. Although she seemed to be in a hurry and did not ask very many questions she was very considerate and kind. I feel as though I will have my problems solved by her recommendations. The nurse, on the other hand, was neither kind nor considerate. I hope that this was just a result of a bad day and that she does not treat patients like this regularly. She was short and made me feel like I was doing something wrong; when I was simply answering her questions to the best of my ability as a first time patient. I came to this clinic because of an acne outbreak that has left my self esteem low. Although I received products that will help me in that, the service from the nurse did not make me feel any better about my problem and instead made me feel as though I was being a problem. The individuals in this clinic have the power to help others feel more empowered in their own skin. I hope Cahaba Dermatology sees that and will do that.

resp.text:
Helping our patients feel empowered to address and resolve their skin issues is our mission. I am sorry we did not deliver for you on this visit. Please call our office and ask to speak with our business manager or medical office manager to see if we can provide a solution to this issue.

Regards,

name: Bailee Perry
text: I had a cyst removed by Dr. Wang and she was excellent. Her nurse did a great and gentle job numbing the area and I felt nothing during the procedure. They have a beautiful office and their staff is welcoming. I’ll definitely go back for yearly exams and recommend them to friends and family.

resp.text: Great to hear. Yearly exams are best way to keep major skin issues from developing. Look forward to seeing you next time.

name: Erin Farella
text: Dr. Wang and her team are wonderful! They are so kind, thorough, and always listen to my concerns. They always make me feel so comfortable and more than just a patient. I highly recommend them!

text: I did not have a good experience here. I scheduled an appointment, and confirmed my appointment time/date. Once I showed up for the appointment though, I waited for about a half hour before being told that there was some kind of mistake and they wouldn’t be able to see me for my appointment I had scheduled over a month ago. I understand mistakes happen, but I was frustrated that I took off of work and showed up at an appointment just for them to cancel it on me. They then said they would talk to the manager to make things right and call me with times I could reschedule, etc...they never called or even apologized to me for the huge in convenience.

text: Really nice presentation but not that great of an overall experience.  Not impressed at all 😕.  Little engagement with review of treatment unless I asked. I was treated almost as if my insurance wasn't good enough. At check out, the rep tried to charge me almost 100.00 for a co-pay I didn't have😳. Now...... Follow up about the set appointment and the patient portal is excellent. PLEASE NOTE......Thats how they even got a star. Portal is easy to use if.......you follow instructions correctly.  Brand new facilities but I think they really are in the business of isolating the population that they serve. Hint hint.

name: pat ryan
text: after much attention to filling out info on the portal we were never about to complete a video appointment - we finally talked to Dr Groysman on our home phone. It was not clear to us as to how to do a video connect. Someone mentioned SPRUCE, but we never had heard of that. In future please make it more clear as to how to do a video appointment. Thanks, Marie West

resp.text:
Reading your review, it sounds like Dr. Groysman worked outside of the normal process to ensure you received the care you needed despite connection issues. We use technology as best as we can to provide telederm visits to our patients during the Covid-19 outbreak. We provide education on Spurce.com our telederm app, but things just do not always go as planned. Conducting a dermatology visit remotely is challenging, but we've taken on this challenge for our valued patients. We do not have control over third party applications, internet connection speeds, and other various factors, but we will work to provide excellent dermatology care in every way we can.

Regards,

name: Chris Williamson
text: Very friendly and accommodating staff!! I arrived at what I thought was my appointment time and date but My appointment was actually a different day. The front desk was able to work me in. text:
From the moment I walked in I was treated with genuine kindness.

...From the lovely lady that greeted me when I walked in... I could feel her smile behind her mask.

...To the amazing nurse that made me feel at ease, answered all of my questions and made me feel comforted immediately. I really trusted her guidance.

...To the wonderful doctor that took her time with me and cared about my concerns. I feel great knowing I’m in here care.

...To the absolutely fantastic woman that took my blood with ease and great conversation.

Each person made my appointment a remarkable experience.  I was scared walking in and was smiling walking out!!

name: Beth Meullen
text:
I met the doctor for a checkup and to remove a few spots. She was very knowledgeable and thorough with my questions. The nurse was also very professional. I was thankful that the doctor offered several options that could fit my budget. I did not feel she was over selling me to pay for their beautiful well designed office. I can say that everyone, including the front desk and checkout, were all extremely careful and professional!
Update: I received my bill. $725 to freeze my nose and one spot on my arm. Then I called in for a quote for blue light treatment. Each treatment is $300 more than 2 years ago. Plus when I google the average cost for this treatment this doctor is quoting more than double! Not saying I won’t receive good care but Wow!

name: Justin Drake
text: Called to set an appointment.  Before even giving me appointment dates, the lady was asking for my insurance card.  Then she proceeded to tell me everything was sent to the lady for biopsy which is a complete money sink and moneymaker for the firm when it clearly isnt required.  I would understand if red or any issues but just a cosmetic procedure is just a way to make additional money.  If they are this greedy out of the gate, you can only imagine what they bill...

resp.text:
When booking an appointment we do ask up front for insurance to best advise patient on coverage and/or any out of pocket costs associated with visit or biopsy. There is no way to advise if a biopsy would be necessary at the time of booking. Only the provider would make that determination. Regarding the "sending" or reading of the biopsy, our office has no financial involvement in this process. Samples are sent to an independent third party for processing and third party bills insurance or patient directly. Please call our office and ask to speak with our business manager if you have any further questions or concerns.

Regards,

name: Lynn Cummings
text: Staff were courteous, professional, and had very good customer service skills. Dr Groysman was professional. thorough , and very helpful in addressing concerns.

name: Lynn Cummings
text: Staff were courteous, professional, and had very good customer service skills. Dr Groysman was professional. thorough , and very helpful in addressing concerns.
